content.description:
Climb the black rock up left and over the slightly overhanging wall above. Great for hot days since it stays in the shade most of the day!

Can be used for the 1st pitch of Moderator.
content.location: On the left portion of the shady wall just right of Defector.

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb Svetlana for about 50' and go right to reach the 2 bolt anchor above a ledge

Pitch 2: Climb some hard moves up the steep walls. 11 bolts to the tips

Up a vertical section to a small dihedral and then a few steep moves before reaching the rounded arete. Great for hot days since it stays in the shade most of the day!

Can be used for the 1st pitch of Moderator.
content.location: Right side of the shady wall.  Just left of an obvious large crack.

content.description: High 1st bolt above the chossy rock, so stick clipping is a smart idea. Up over the chossy pillar then tackle the pumpy middle pillar culiminating with a big move to reach the undercling under the roof, and then pulling the bulge. Easier but more technical moves finish up the route on holds slopier than you would expect.
content.location: The left side of the lower Shock Block face.

content.description: A 3rd pitch.  Up initial shared arete with Moderator then pull onto the vertical headwall, but traverse left to its own finish.
content.location: This is the left 3rd pitch above Drive-In.

content.description: From the pillar belay, straight up the arete then step right and follow the the line of bolts over the bulge and up to the pinnacle of the wall! It is possible to top it out and walk off!

Head up the left side of the wide crack on good holds to a large chunky steep section that is conquered by going up and then slightly right over the lip. The upper headwall is reasonably tricky and a good rest isn't reached for 2 more bolts above the roof!
content.location: Just left of the crack that is splitting the lower face of the Shock Block.  The bolts on this route are painted black.

content.description:
This was the 1st route on the Shock Block.

Start up the chossy water streak and then follow the face just right of the crack until the bulge. Pull the bulge and trend right across huge pockets up to the featured face above.
content.location: Just right of the crack splitting the lower Shock Block face.

content.description: Up the slab, then climb the border of the right tower and the left with face and wide crack moves.  This is the 2nd pitch of Moderator.
content.location: This is a 2nd pitch above Warcraft or Svetlana and goes up the corner / wide crack.

content.description: From the slab anchors above Warcraft or Svetlana, go up the slab, but step left on the small pillar then up and over the bulge
content.location: Above Warcraft and slightly left.  This can only be done as a second pitch.

content.description: Clip the 1st bolt from the ledge, then step off and right with insta-exposure! Crank up the large holds on alternating vertical and steep terrain till the final slab before the anchors. Classic! There is a 4 bolt Direct Start which starts on a lower tier of rock and goes up a nice dihedral (12 bolts - MUST use a 60M!).
content.protection: 8 or 12 bolts depending on where you start.
content.location:
Start on the far right of the ledge (8 bolts). here is a 4 bolt Direct Start which starts on a lower tier of rock and goes up a nice dihedral (12

bolts - MUST use a 60M!).

content.description: Another Shock Block sweet route on the Shock Block! Start up the left side of the main face with a tricky move moving past the 1st bolt. Follow the cool features till the base of the triangular roof above. Pull this dead center, then tackle the easier slabier wall above.
content.location: Just right of the obvious large crack on the left portion of the Shock Block.  This climb makes the arete to the lower steeper face containing Idle Hands and is just left of Spankterfied.
